title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Desk", March 1, 1937
medium: Graphite, black ink, red and blue color pencil on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 8557/F.S.D./ANDERSON, OLSSON/P.S./D./3.1.37, 3/13/37, 1, MASTERCR.; inscribed in graphite, left of stamp: ONE DESK 54 x 33" x 30" H/MACASSAR EBONY/FINISH ALL AROUND/INTERIOR IN WALNUT/PULLS POL. CHROM./LIGHT BY OTHERS/WIRE OUTLET/FOUR DRAWERS - PROVIDE STOPPERS./DRAWER ABOVE KNEEHOLE TO HAVE SLIDING PENCIL TRAY/ONE DOOR ADJ. SHELF BEHIND/PROVIDE EXTRA PANE FOR SWITCH BOX OPENING/GRAIN OF PANEL SAME AS TOP/USE DOMES OF SILENCE/VENEER ALL EXPOSED EDGES ALSO TOP EDGES OF DRAWER/AND DOOR EDGES; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for desk in Macassar ebony, interior in walnut. Rectangular shape with distinct grain pattern. Pedestal at left with three stacked drawers of different heights; horizontal pulls in polished chrome near right of drawers. Knee hole space at center for chair; one drawer beneath surface with sliding pencil tray. Opening at top for switch box of phone. Horizontal, tubular lighting fixture affixed to desk at left. Cabinet on exterior of desk at pedestal; no pull.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Desk", March 1, 1937.
March 1, 1937. Graphite, black ink, red and blue color pencil on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-971.
